intro: Simpliglottis pluricallata, commonly known as the rough-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has a compact growth habit and is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value. Simpliglottis pluricallata is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
